item.title: Report E-2025030446
item.description:
Report E-2025030446

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-26
  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 26, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2735 was forked and released approximately one (1) gallon to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES+ to remediate the site. The crew utilized soda ash, absorbents, and hand tools tor remediate the trailer interior. All waste was containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025031433
item.description:
Report X-2025031433

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-24
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE HAZMAT AUDITOR FLOOR AREA, AUDITOR NOTICED LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE ON TOP OF ANOTHER HAMZAT PACKAGE. AUDITOR DIDN'T TOUCH THE LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE, LEFT THE AREA, AND NOTIFIED THEIR SUPERVISOR. SUPERVISOR NOTIFIED RMP AND RMP NOTIFIED DESIGNATED RESPONDER. RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH THEIR PPE ON, STOCKED SPILL CART, AND CURRENT DESICION TREE. RESPONDER NOTICED THAT THE LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE HAD A FLAMMABLE LIQUID LABEL. RESPONDER READ AND FOLLOWED CURRENT DESICION TREE, WHICH LED THEM TO THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET. SINCE THERE WAS ONLY CONTAMINATION ON ANOTHER HAZMAT PACKAGE AND NOT ELSEWHERE, ZEP ZORBENT WAS NOT NEEDED. RESPONDER CONTAINED LEAKING FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT PACKAGE AND GRABBED THE OTHER HAZMAT PACKAGE ONTO THE SPILL CART. RESPONDER HEADED BACK TO THE PSC CAGE WITH BOTH PACKAGES TO START PROCESSING. AFTER RESPONDER PROCESSED DAMAGED MATERIALS INTO A GREEN BAG, THEY DECONTAMINATED THEIR PPE.

item.title: Report X-2025031434
item.description:
Report X-2025031434

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-24
  • City: ROCK FALLS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO SPILL IN FULL PPE WITH DECISION TREE IN HAND PUT PRODUCT IN GREY TOTE AND TRANSPORTED TO PROCESSING AREA. SOLIDIFIED WITH ZEP ZORBANT TESTED PH READING OF 1 APPLIED SODIUM BICARBONATE UNTIL TESTED NEUTRAL. FOLLOWED WASTE DISPOSAL CHART AND FINISHED PROCESSING WITH 5 GALLON BUCKET

item.title: Report E-2025030465
item.description:
Report E-2025030465

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-04
  • City: DES PLAINES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately four (4) gallons of material released from one (1) 50-gallon metal drum due to a forklift accident that resulted in the drum being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 10-gallon poly drum. One (1) 85-gallon metal drum was used to containerize the damaged 50-gallon drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025030381
item.description:
Report E-2025030381

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-29
  • City: DEKALB
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: J. B. HUNT TRANSPORT SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 60000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the personnel observed that the released material impacted two areas measuring approximately 53ft-by-8ft of the trailer floor and 100ft-by-100ft of the asphalt parking lot and estimated that three hundred and thirty (330) gallons of material was released due to a defective closure on one (1) 330-gallon metal tote. Hepaco personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material. The recovered material was containerized into five (5) cubic yard boxes and five (5) 55-gallon metal drums. The generated waste was transported offsite for disposal.
